com.google.android.glass.TMM

Class DBManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.glass.TMM.DBManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.couchbase.lite.replicator.Replication.ChangeListener

    public class DBManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.couchbase.lite.replicator.Replication.ChangeListener
    The Class DBManager. This class provides a friendly API for retrieving/storing TMMCard objects from the NoSQL database. Note that some of the methods in this class make network accesses, which should be done asynchronously. Since we only make calls to a DB on localhost, we should not have any network latency so we simply block on the network threads. If this class is used with an actual remote DB (it can be configured to do this quite easily), then this approach could cause major freezing due to network failure/latency. Care should then be exercised to account for the latency in such a situation.

    • Method Detail

      • isSynced

        public boolean isSynced()
        Checks if the database currently open in the manager is synchronized with the master database.
        Returns:
        true, if the database has completed its synchronization.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the currently open database contained in this manager.
        Returns:
        THe name of the database. Note that this is usually the project name and will NOT be a URL.

      • open

        public boolean open(java.lang.String dbName,
                    Context context)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    com.couchbase.lite.CouchbaseLiteException
        Opens the database with the name specified, and synchronizes it. The isSynced() function should be used to check for the completion of the synchronization before using the newly opened database. If the database with the specified name does not exist, then it will be created.
        Parameters:
        dbName - The name of the database to open (if it exists) or create if it does not exist.
        context - The current context to use for the opening of the database.
        Returns:
        true, if the synchronization starts with no apparent problems.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        com.couchbase.lite.CouchbaseLiteException - Signals that an exception with the local NoSQL DB has been thrown during initialization and/or sync.

      • startCBLListener

        private int startCBLListener(int suggestedListenPort)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             com.couchbase.lite.CouchbaseLiteException
        Starts a local Couchbase lite NoSQL DB listening on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        suggestedListenPort - The number of the suggested port to listen on.
        Returns:
        The port that the DB is listening on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        com.couchbase.lite.CouchbaseLiteException - Signals that an exception with the local NoSQL DB has been thrown during initialization.

      • getEntireDbAsJSON

        public JSONObject[] getEntireDbAsJSON(java.lang.String serverURLsansPort,
                                      int port,
                                      java.lang.String dbName)
        Obtains every document in a couchDB in the form of a JSON object.
        Parameters:
        serverURLsansPort - The URL of the server (without the port).
        port - The port number of the server.
        dbName - The name of the database (in this case project). NOT A URL
        Returns:
        Array of JSONObjects containing all documents associated with a given database.

      • getDocumentAsJSON

        public JSONObject getDocumentAsJSON(java.lang.String serverURLsansPort,
                                    int port,
                                    java.lang.String dbName,
                                    java.lang.String UUID)
        Obtains a single document from a couchDB with a given database name and UUID.
        Parameters:
        serverURLsansPort - The URL of the server (without the port).
        port - The port number of the server.
        dbName - The name of the database (in this case project).
        UUID - The String UUID of the requested document.
        Returns:
        The requested document in the form of a JSON Object. Returns null if creation fails.

      • downloadVideoCardAttachments

        private boolean downloadVideoCardAttachments(VideoCard cardToDl)
        Download all attachments for specified VideoCard object. Attachments will be saved at paths designated in parameter object. This is a helper method for the above getAllAttachments() method.
        Parameters:
        cardToDl - The VideoCard object with paths for attachments set, but no actual attachment files at those paths.
        Returns:
        true, if all attachments for the card downloaded successfully.

      • getSingleAttachment

        private boolean getSingleAttachment(java.lang.String attachmentName,
                                    java.lang.String uuidOfDoc,
                                    java.lang.String pathToStore)
        Gets the single attachment. Essentially an API wrapper for the attachment downloader runnable. This methods returns with the attachment in a known state - completely downloaded and saved to the local filesystem.
        Parameters:
        attachmentName - The name of the attachment to download, NOT the path.
        uuidOfDoc - The UUID of the parent document of the attachment.
        pathToStore - The local filesystem path to store the downloaded attachment file.
        Returns:
        true, if the attachment was downloaded successfully.

      • deleteDB

        public boolean deleteDB(boolean areYouSure)
        Deletes the database currently open in this db manager.
        Parameters:
        areYouSure - Just to check that you know what you are doing
        Returns:
        true, if the DB was successfully deleted.

      • findCardById

        public TMMCard findCardById(java.lang.String uuid)
        Find a card in the database by UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID of the card to retrieve. If it is not an exact match to an actual UUID, then the call will fail.
        Returns:
        The TMMCard with the specified UUID retrieved from the database.

      • getJSONRepresentation

        public JSONObject getJSONRepresentation(TMMCard toCheck)
        Gets the JSON representation of the specified TMMCard. The TMMCard must have a valid UUID for a valid JSONObject to be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        toCheck - The card to obtain the JSON representation from the DB of.
        Returns:
        The JSONOBject of the specified TMMCard, if the card can be found in the DB.

      • addCard

        public boolean addCard(TMMCard toAdd)
                throws org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerationException,
                       org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Adds a TMMCard to the database.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - The TMMCard to add to the database.
        Returns:
        true, if the card was successfully added.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the is an IO problem while adding the card.
        org.codehaus.jackson.map.JsonMappingException - Thrown if there is a problem mapping the card object to a JSON string to store in the DB.
        org.codehaus.jackson.JsonGenerationException - Thrown if there is a problem generating the JSON form of the card.

      • getUUID

        private java.lang.String getUUID()
        Gets a new uuid from the database to use for the addition of new material to the DB.
        Returns:
        A string containing a valid UUID from the database.

      • uploadCardAttachments

        private boolean uploadCardAttachments(TMMCard toAdd,
                                      JSONObject jsonObject)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Upload all card attachments for a single TMMCard.
        Parameters:
        toAdd - The card containing valid paths to the files to be uploaded.
        jsonObject - The JSON object returned when the card was added to the database. This is used to revise and access the card in the DB to add the attachments.
        Returns:
        true, if all of the card's attachments were uploaded successfully
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

      • uploadSingleAttachment

        private boolean uploadSingleAttachment(byte[] data,
                                       JSONObject jsonObject,
                                       java.lang.String fileName,
                                       java.lang.String contentType)
        Upload single attachment to the JSONObject passed in.
        Parameters:
        data - The binary representation of the attachment to store in the database.
        jsonObject - The JSON Object containing the identifier and revision number of the document to which the attachment will be uploaded.
        fileName - The attachment's filename, which is what it will be called after it is attached.
        contentType - The MIME-type, useful for browsers wishing to view the content.
        Returns:
        true, if the attachment is successfully uploaded

      • getEntireDbAsJSON

        public java.lang.String getEntireDbAsJSON()
        Get the entire contents of the currently open database as a JSON string.
        Returns:
        A string containing the JSON representation of all the documents in the currently open DB.

      • deleteCardfromDB

        public boolean deleteCardfromDB(TMMCard todel)
        Delete the specified card from the database. In order for a successful deletion to occur, the specified card MUST have a valid UUID, as that is how the DB copy is accessed and deleted.
        Parameters:
        todel - The TMMCard object to delete from the database.
        Returns:
        true, if the specified card was successfully deleted from the database.

      • createNewDB

        public boolean createNewDB(java.lang.String dbname)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Creates a new database with the specified name locally, then synchronizes the new database with the remote repository.
        Parameters:
        dbname - The name of the database to create.
        Returns:
        true, if the database has been created successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - Thrown if the input stream cannot be read properly. s * @throws IOException Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        java.io.IOException

      • getAllCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<TMMCard> getAllCards()
        Gets ALL cards from all servers, sorted by priority.
        Returns:
        The arrayList of TMMCard objects that consists of every card from every database maintained locally by the app.

      • findCardsbyServer

        public java.util.ArrayList<TMMCard> findCardsbyServer()
        Retrieve all the cards from the currently open database in the DBManager object.
        Returns:
        The arraylist of all available TMMCard objects for the currently open database.
